info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 24 at 1:19PM PDT until August 25 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Abundant lightning on dry fuels is anticipated this afternoon into early Friday morning... .An upper level wave will move into the region from the south this afternoon and overnight. Thunderstorms are anticipated to pop up across the region with the most impactful activity expected west of the I-5 corridor. This area missed out on the beneficial rainfall from Hurricane Hilary remnants and the threat for new fire ignitions is highest in this area. Thunderstorm activity is also anticipated east of the Cascades, but given recent rainfall in this area, the threat of lightning ignited fires should be diminished. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 AM PDT FRIDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 618, 619, AND 621... * IMPACTS...A higher threat of lightning ignited wild fires. Any fires that develop have a higher probability of spreading rapidly. Abundant lightning can also ignite new fires and strain fire fighting resources. * AFFECTED AREA...FWZ 619 and FWZ 618... This includes the Flat Fire. Western sections of FWZ 621. * THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated to scattered high based storms that are likely to be mostly dry or have little precipitation. Lightning strikes outside of precipitation cores are possible and cause for concern. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusts up to 35 mph. * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Gather your fire evacuation kit now and familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information.
